instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 on trackpad/keyboard
threads.message:
Good morning, 
I made tests with new pieces, but it doesn't work. It replaces the u4801, taken from the donor plate 820-3332, but it was not successful either. Can you tell me what it can be ?

threads.title: 820-3662 on trackpad/keyboard
threads.message:
Not sure if 3332 fits 3662.
This chip has firmware, but may be not platform dependent.
Put back original chip and measure signals and voltages around U4801.

Be sure BUTTON_DISABLE stays low.
